005package edu.wpi.first.networktables;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.util.WPIUtilJNI;
008import edu.wpi.first.util.concurrent.Event;
009import edu.wpi.first.util.datalog.DataLog;
010import java.util.EnumSet;
011import java.util.HashMap;
012import java.util.Map;
013import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
014import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap;
015import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
016import java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition;
017import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
018import java.util.function.Consumer;
019
020/**
021 * NetworkTables Instance.
022 *
023 * <p>Instances are completely independent from each other. Table operations on one instance will
024 * not be visible to other instances unless the instances are connected via the network. The main
025 * limitation on instances is that you cannot have two servers on the same network port. The main
026 * utility of instances is for unit testing, but they can also enable one program to connect to two
027 * different NetworkTables networks.
028 *
029 * <p>The global "default" instance (as returned by {@link #getDefault()}) is always available, and
030 * is intended for the common case when there is only a single NetworkTables instance being used in
031 * the program.
032 *
033 * <p>Additional instances can be created with the {@link #create()} function. A reference must be
034 * kept to the NetworkTableInstance returned by this function to keep it from being garbage
035 * collected.
036 */
037@SuppressWarnings("PMD.CouplingBetweenObjects")
038public final class NetworkTableInstance implements AutoCloseable {
039  /** Client/server mode flag values (as returned by {@link #getNetworkMode()}). */
040  public enum NetworkMode {
041    /** Running in server mode. */
042    kServer(0x01),
043
044    /** Running in NT3 client mode. */
045    kClient3(0x02),
046
047    /** Running in NT4 client mode. */
048    kClient4(0x04),
049
050    /** Currently starting up (either client or server). */
051    kStarting(0x08),
052
053    /** Running in local-only mode. */
054    kLocal(0x10);
055
056    private final int value;
057
058    NetworkMode(int value) {
059      this.value = value;
060    }
061
062    public int getValue() {
063      return value;
064    }
065  }
066
067  /** The default port that network tables operates on for NT3. */
068  public static final int kDefaultPort3 = 1735;
069
070  /** The default port that network tables operates on for NT4. */
071  public static final int kDefaultPort4 = 5810;
072
073  /**
074   * Construct from native handle.
075   *
076   * @param handle Native handle
077   */
078  private NetworkTableInstance(int handle) {
079    m_owned = false;
080    m_handle = handle;
081  }
082
083  /** Destroys the instance (if created by {@link #create()}). */
084  @Override
085  public synchronized void close() {
086    if (m_owned && m_handle != 0) {
087      m_listeners.close();
088      NetworkTablesJNI.destroyInstance(m_handle);
089      m_handle = 0;
090    }
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Determines if the native handle is valid.
095   *
096   * @return True if the native handle is valid, false otherwise.
097   */
098  public boolean isValid() {
099    return m_handle != 0;
100  }
101
102  /* The default instance. */
103  private static NetworkTableInstance s_defaultInstance;
104
105  /**
106   * Get global default instance.
107   *
108   * @return Global default instance
109   */
110  public static synchronized NetworkTableInstance getDefault() {
111    if (s_defaultInstance == null) {
112      s_defaultInstance = new NetworkTableInstance(NetworkTablesJNI.getDefaultInstance());
113    }
114    return s_defaultInstance;
115  }
116
117  /**
118   * Create an instance. Note: A reference to the returned instance must be retained to ensure the
119   * instance is not garbage collected.
120   *
121   * @return Newly created instance
122   */
123  public static NetworkTableInstance create() {
124    NetworkTableInstance inst = new NetworkTableInstance(NetworkTablesJNI.createInstance());
125    inst.m_owned = true;
126    return inst;
127  }
128
129  /**
130   * Gets the native handle for the instance.
131   *
132   * @return Native handle
133   */
134  public int getHandle() {
135    return m_handle;
136  }
137
138  /**
139   * Get (generic) topic.
140   *
141   * @param name topic name
142   * @return Topic
143   */
144  public Topic getTopic(String name) {
145    Topic topic = m_topics.get(name);
146    if (topic == null) {
147      int handle = NetworkTablesJNI.getTopic(m_handle, name);
148      topic = new Topic(this, handle);
149      Topic oldTopic = m_topics.putIfAbsent(name, topic);
150      if (oldTopic != null) {
151        topic = oldTopic;
152      }
153      // also cache by handle
154      m_topicsByHandle.putIfAbsent(handle, topic);
155    }
156    return topic;
157  }
158
159  /**
160   * Get boolean topic.
161   *
162   * @param name topic name
163   * @return BooleanTopic
164   */
165  public BooleanTopic getBooleanTopic(String name) {
166    Topic topic = m_topics.get(name);
167    if (topic instanceof BooleanTopic) {
168      return (BooleanTopic) topic;
169    }
170
171    int handle;
172    if (topic == null) {
173      handle = NetworkTablesJNI.getTopic(m_handle, name);
174    } else {
175      handle = topic.getHandle();
176    }
177
178    topic = new BooleanTopic(this, handle);
179    m_topics.put(name, topic);
180
181    // also cache by handle
182    m_topicsByHandle.put(handle, topic);
183
184    return (BooleanTopic) topic;
185  }
186
187  /**
188   * Get long topic.
189   *
190   * @param name topic name
191   * @return IntegerTopic
192   */
193  public IntegerTopic getIntegerTopic(String name) {
194    Topic topic = m_topics.get(name);
195    if (topic instanceof IntegerTopic) {
196      return (IntegerTopic) topic;
197    }
198
199    int handle;
200    if (topic == null) {
201      handle = NetworkTablesJNI.getTopic(m_handle, name);
202    } else {
203      handle = topic.getHandle();
204    }
205
206    topic = new IntegerTopic(this, handle);
207    m_topics.put(name, topic);
208
209    // also cache by handle
210    m_topicsByHandle.put(handle, topic);
211
212    return (IntegerTopic) topic;
213  }

463
464    return (StringArrayTopic) topic;
465  }
466
467  private Topic[] topicHandlesToTopics(int[] handles) {
468    Topic[] topics = new Topic[handles.length];
469    for (int i = 0; i < handles.length; i++) {
470      topics[i] = getCachedTopic(handles[i]);
471    }
472    return topics;
473  }
474
475  /**
476   * Get all published topics.
477   *
478   * @return Array of topics.
479   */
480  public Topic[] getTopics() {
481    return topicHandlesToTopics(NetworkTablesJNI.getTopics(m_handle, "", 0));
482  }
483
484  /**
485   * Get published topics starting with the given prefix. The results are optionally filtered by
486   * string prefix to only return a subset of all topics.
487   *
488   * @param prefix topic name required prefix; only topics whose name starts with this string are
489   *     returned
490   * @return Array of topic information.
491   */
492  public Topic[] getTopics(String prefix) {
493    return topicHandlesToTopics(NetworkTablesJNI.getTopics(m_handle, prefix, 0));
494  }
495
496  /**
497   * Get published topics starting with the given prefix. The results are optionally filtered by
498   * string prefix and data type to only return a subset of all topics.
499   *
500   * @param prefix topic name required prefix; only topics whose name starts with this string are
501   *     returned
502   * @param types bitmask of data types; 0 is treated as a "don't care"
503   * @return Array of topic information.
504   */
505  public Topic[] getTopics(String prefix, int types) {
506    return topicHandlesToTopics(NetworkTablesJNI.getTopics(m_handle, prefix, types));
507  }
508
509  /**
510   * Get published topics starting with the given prefix. The results are optionally filtered by
511   * string prefix and data type to only return a subset of all topics.
512   *
513   * @param prefix topic name required prefix; only topics whose name starts with this string are
514   *     returned
515   * @param types array of data type strings
516   * @return Array of topic information.
517   */
518  public Topic[] getTopics(String prefix, String[] types) {
519    return topicHandlesToTopics(NetworkTablesJNI.getTopicsStr(m_handle, prefix, types));
520  }
521

523   * Get information about all topics.
524   *
525   * @return Array of topic information.
526   */
527  public TopicInfo[] getTopicInfo() {
528    return NetworkTablesJNI.getTopicInfos(this, m_handle, "", 0);
529  }

567  }
568
569  /* Cache of created entries. */
570  private final ConcurrentMap<String, NetworkTableEntry> m_entries = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
571
572  /**
573   * Gets the entry for a key.
574   *
575   * @param name Key
576   * @return Network table entry.
577   */
578  public NetworkTableEntry getEntry(String name) {
579    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_entries.get(name);
580    if (entry == null) {
581      entry = new NetworkTableEntry(this, NetworkTablesJNI.getEntry(m_handle, name));
582      NetworkTableEntry oldEntry = m_entries.putIfAbsent(name, entry);
583      if (oldEntry != null) {
584        entry = oldEntry;
585      }
586    }
587    return entry;
588  }
589
590  /* Cache of created topics. */
591  private final ConcurrentMap<String, Topic> m_topics = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
592  private final ConcurrentMap<Integer, Topic> m_topicsByHandle = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
593
594  Topic getCachedTopic(String name) {
595    Topic topic = m_topics.get(name);
596    if (topic == null) {
597      int handle = NetworkTablesJNI.getTopic(m_handle, name);
598      topic = new Topic(this, handle);
599      Topic oldTopic = m_topics.putIfAbsent(name, topic);
600      if (oldTopic != null) {
601        topic = oldTopic;
602      }
603      // also cache by handle
604      m_topicsByHandle.putIfAbsent(handle, topic);
605    }
606    return topic;
607  }
608
609  Topic getCachedTopic(int handle) {
610    Topic topic = m_topicsByHandle.get(handle);
611    if (topic == null) {
612      topic = new Topic(this, handle);
613      Topic oldTopic = m_topicsByHandle.putIfAbsent(handle, topic);
614      if (oldTopic != null) {
615        topic = oldTopic;
616      }
617    }
618    return topic;
619  }
620
621  /* Cache of created tables. */
622  private final ConcurrentMap<String, NetworkTable> m_tables = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
623
624  /**
625   * Gets the table with the specified key.
626   *
627   * @param key the key name
628   * @return The network table
629   */
630  public NetworkTable getTable(String key) {
631    // prepend leading / if not present
632    String theKey;
633    if (key.isEmpty() || "/".equals(key)) {
634      theKey = "";
635    } else if (key.charAt(0) == NetworkTable.PATH_SEPARATOR) {
636      theKey = key;
637    } else {
638      theKey = NetworkTable.PATH_SEPARATOR + key;
639    }
640
641    // cache created tables
642    NetworkTable table = m_tables.get(theKey);
643    if (table == null) {
644      table = new NetworkTable(this, theKey);
645      NetworkTable oldTable = m_tables.putIfAbsent(theKey, table);
646      if (oldTable != null) {
647        table = oldTable;
648      }
649    }
650    return table;
651  }
652
653  /*
654   * Callback Creation Functions
655   */
656
657  private static class ListenerStorage implements AutoCloseable {
658    private final ReentrantLock m_lock = new ReentrantLock();
659    private final Map<Integer, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent>> m_listeners = new HashMap<>();
660    private Thread m_thread;
661    private int m_poller;
662    private boolean m_waitQueue;
663    private final Event m_waitQueueEvent = new Event();
664    private final Condition m_waitQueueCond = m_lock.newCondition();
665    private final NetworkTableInstance m_inst;
666
667    ListenerStorage(NetworkTableInstance inst) {
668      m_inst = inst;
669    }
670
671    int add(
672        String[] prefixes,
673        EnumSet<NetworkTableEvent.Kind> eventKinds,
674        Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
675      m_lock.lock();
676      try {
677        if (m_poller == 0) {
678          m_poller = NetworkTablesJNI.createListenerPoller(m_inst.getHandle());
679          startThread();
680        }
681        int h = NetworkTablesJNI.addListener(m_poller, prefixes, eventKinds);
682        m_listeners.put(h, listener);
683        return h;
684      } finally {
685        m_lock.unlock();
686      }
687    }
688
689    int add(
690        int handle,
691        EnumSet<NetworkTableEvent.Kind> eventKinds,
692        Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
693      m_lock.lock();
694      try {
695        if (m_poller == 0) {
696          m_poller = NetworkTablesJNI.createListenerPoller(m_inst.getHandle());
697          startThread();
698        }
699        int h = NetworkTablesJNI.addListener(m_poller, handle, eventKinds);
700        m_listeners.put(h, listener);
701        return h;
702      } finally {
703        m_lock.unlock();
704      }
705    }
706
707    int addLogger(int minLevel, int maxLevel, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
708      m_lock.lock();
709      try {
710        if (m_poller == 0) {
711          m_poller = NetworkTablesJNI.createListenerPoller(m_inst.getHandle());
712          startThread();
713        }
714        int h = NetworkTablesJNI.addLogger(m_poller, minLevel, maxLevel);
715        m_listeners.put(h, listener);
716        return h;
717      } finally {
718        m_lock.unlock();
719      }
720    }
721
722    void remove(int listener) {
723      m_lock.lock();
724      try {
725        m_listeners.remove(listener);
726      } finally {
727        m_lock.unlock();
728      }
729      NetworkTablesJNI.removeListener(listener);
730    }
731
732    @Override
733    public void close() {
734      if (m_poller != 0) {
735        NetworkTablesJNI.destroyListenerPoller(m_poller);
736      }
737      m_poller = 0;
738    }
739
740    private void startThread() {
741      m_thread =
742          new Thread(
743              () -> {
744                boolean wasInterrupted = false;
745                int[] handles = new int[] { m_poller, m_waitQueueEvent.getHandle() };
746                while (!Thread.interrupted()) {
747                  try {
748                    WPIUtilJNI.waitForObjects(handles);
749                  } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
750                    m_lock.lock();
751                    try {
752                      if (m_waitQueue) {
753                        m_waitQueue = false;
754                        m_waitQueueCond.signalAll();
755                      }
756                    } finally {
757                      m_lock.unlock();
758                    }
759                    Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
760                    // don't try to destroy poller, as its handle is likely no longer valid
761                    wasInterrupted = true;
762                    break;
763                  }
764                  for (NetworkTableEvent event :
765                      NetworkTablesJNI.readListenerQueue(m_inst, m_poller)) {
766                    Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener;
767                    m_lock.lock();
768                    try {
769                      listener = m_listeners.get(event.listener);
770                    } finally {
771                      m_lock.unlock();
772                    }
773                    if (listener != null) {
774                      try {
775                        listener.accept(event);
776                      } catch (Throwable throwable) {
777                        System.err.println(
778                            "Unhandled exception during listener callback: "
779                            + throwable.toString());
780                        throwable.printStackTrace();
781                      }
782                    }
783                  }
784                  m_lock.lock();
785                  try {
786                    if (m_waitQueue) {
787                      m_waitQueue = false;
788                      m_waitQueueCond.signalAll();
789                    }
790                  } finally {
791                    m_lock.unlock();
792                  }
793                }
794                m_lock.lock();
795                try {
796                  if (!wasInterrupted) {
797                    NetworkTablesJNI.destroyListenerPoller(m_poller);
798                  }
799                  m_poller = 0;
800                } finally {
801                  m_lock.unlock();
802                }
803              },
804              "NTListener");
805      m_thread.setDaemon(true);
806      m_thread.start();
807    }
808
809    boolean waitForQueue(double timeout) {
810      m_lock.lock();
811      try {
812        if (m_poller != 0) {
813          m_waitQueue = true;
814          m_waitQueueEvent.set();
815          while (m_waitQueue) {
816            try {
817              if (timeout < 0) {
818                m_waitQueueCond.await();
819              } else {
820                return m_waitQueueCond.await((long) (timeout * 1e9), TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS);
821              }
822            } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
823              Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
824              return true;
825            }
826          }
827        }
828      } finally {
829        m_lock.unlock();
830      }
831      return true;
832    }
833  }
834
835  private ListenerStorage m_listeners = new ListenerStorage(this);
836
837  /**
838   * Remove a connection listener.
839   *
840   * @param listener Listener handle to remove
841   */
842  public void removeListener(int listener) {
843    m_listeners.remove(listener);
844  }
845
846  /**
847   * Wait for the listener queue to be empty. This is primarily useful for deterministic
848   * testing. This blocks until either the listener queue is empty (e.g. there are no
849   * more events that need to be passed along to callbacks or poll queues) or the timeout expires.
850   *
851   * @param timeout timeout, in seconds. Set to 0 for non-blocking behavior, or a negative value to
852   *     block indefinitely
853   * @return False if timed out, otherwise true.
854   */
855  public boolean waitForListenerQueue(double timeout) {
856    return m_listeners.waitForQueue(timeout);
857  }
858
859  /**
860   * Add a connection listener. The callback function is called asynchronously on a separate
861   * thread, so it's important to use synchronization or atomics when accessing any shared state
862   * from the callback function.
863   *
864   * @param immediateNotify Notify listener of all existing connections
865   * @param listener Listener to add
866   * @return Listener handle
867   */
868  public int addConnectionListener(
869      boolean immediateNotify, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
870    EnumSet<NetworkTableEvent.Kind> eventKinds = EnumSet.of(NetworkTableEvent.Kind.kConnection);
871    if (immediateNotify) {
872      eventKinds.add(NetworkTableEvent.Kind.kImmediate);
873    }
874    return m_listeners.add(m_handle, eventKinds, listener);
875  }
876
877  /**
878   * Add a listener for changes on a particular topic. The callback function is called
879   * asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's important to use synchronization or atomics when
880   * accessing any shared state from the callback function.
881   *
882   * <p>This creates a corresponding internal subscriber with the lifetime of the
883   * listener.
884   *
885   * @param topic Topic
886   * @param eventKinds set of event kinds to listen to
887   * @param listener Listener function
888   * @return Listener handle
889   */
890  public int addListener(
891      Topic topic,
892      EnumSet<NetworkTableEvent.Kind> eventKinds,
893      Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
894    if (topic.getInstance().getHandle() != m_handle) {
895      throw new IllegalArgumentException("topic is not from this instance");
896    }
897    return m_listeners.add(topic.getHandle(), eventKinds, listener);
898  }
899
900  /**
901   * Add a listener for changes on a subscriber. The callback function is called
902   * asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's important to use synchronization or atomics when
903   * accessing any shared state from the callback function. This does NOT keep the subscriber
904   * active.
905   *
906   * @param subscriber Subscriber
907   * @param eventKinds set of event kinds to listen to
908   * @param listener Listener function
909   * @return Listener handle
910   */
911  public int addListener(
912      Subscriber subscriber,
913      EnumSet<NetworkTableEvent.Kind> eventKinds,
914      Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
915    if (subscriber.getTopic().getInstance().getHandle() != m_handle) {
916      throw new IllegalArgumentException("subscriber is not from this instance");
917    }
918    return m_listeners.add(subscriber.getHandle(), eventKinds, listener);
919  }
920
921  /**
922   * Add a listener for changes on a subscriber. The callback function is called
923   * asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's important to use synchronization or atomics when
924   * accessing any shared state from the callback function. This does NOT keep the subscriber
925   * active.
926   *
927   * @param subscriber Subscriber
928   * @param eventKinds set of event kinds to listen to
929   * @param listener Listener function
930   * @return Listener handle
931   */
932  public int addListener(
933      MultiSubscriber subscriber,
934      EnumSet<NetworkTableEvent.Kind> eventKinds,
935      Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
936    if (subscriber.getInstance().getHandle() != m_handle) {
937      throw new IllegalArgumentException("subscriber is not from this instance");
938    }
939    return m_listeners.add(subscriber.getHandle(), eventKinds, listener);
940  }
941
942  /**
943   * Add a listener for changes on an entry. The callback function is called
944   * asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's important to use synchronization or atomics when
945   * accessing any shared state from the callback function.
946   *
947   * @param entry Entry
948   * @param eventKinds set of event kinds to listen to
949   * @param listener Listener function
950   * @return Listener handle
951   */
952  public int addListener(
953      NetworkTableEntry entry,
954      EnumSet<NetworkTableEvent.Kind> eventKinds,
955      Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
956    if (entry.getTopic().getInstance().getHandle() != m_handle) {
957      throw new IllegalArgumentException("entry is not from this instance");
958    }
959    return m_listeners.add(entry.getHandle(), eventKinds, listener);
960  }
961
962  /**
963   * Add a listener for changes to topics with names that start with any of the given
964   * prefixes. The callback function is called asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's
965   * important to use synchronization or atomics when accessing any shared state from the callback
966   * function.
967   *
968   * <p>This creates a corresponding internal subscriber with the lifetime of the
969   * listener.
970   *
971   * @param prefixes Topic name string prefixes
972   * @param eventKinds set of event kinds to listen to
973   * @param listener Listener function
974   * @return Listener handle
975   */
976  public int addListener(
977      String[] prefixes,
978      EnumSet<NetworkTableEvent.Kind> eventKinds,
979      Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
980    return m_listeners.add(prefixes, eventKinds, listener);
981  }
982
983  /*
984   * Client/Server Functions
985   */
986
987  /**
988   * Get the current network mode.
989   *
990   * @return Enum set of NetworkMode.
991   */
992  public EnumSet<NetworkMode> getNetworkMode() {
993    int flags = NetworkTablesJNI.getNetworkMode(m_handle);
994    EnumSet<NetworkMode> rv = EnumSet.noneOf(NetworkMode.class);
995    for (NetworkMode mode : NetworkMode.values()) {
996      if ((flags & mode.getValue()) != 0) {
997        rv.add(mode);
998      }
999    }
1000    return rv;
1001  }
1002
1003  /**
1004   * Starts local-only operation. Prevents calls to startServer or startClient from taking effect.
1005   * Has no effect if startServer or startClient has already been called.
1006   */
1007  public void startLocal() {
1008    NetworkTablesJNI.startLocal(m_handle);
1009  }
1010
1011  /**
1012   * Stops local-only operation. startServer or startClient can be called after this call to start
1013   * a server or client.
1014   */
1015  public void stopLocal() {
1016    NetworkTablesJNI.stopLocal(m_handle);
1017  }
1018
1019  /**
1020   * Starts a server using the networktables.json as the persistent file, using the default
1021   * listening address and port.
1022   */
1023  public void startServer() {
1024    startServer("networktables.json");
1025  }
1026
1027  /**
1028   * Starts a server using the specified persistent filename, using the default listening address
1029   * and port.
1030   *
1031   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
1032   */
1033  public void startServer(String persistFilename) {
1034    startServer(persistFilename, "");
1035  }
1036
1037  /**
1038   * Starts a server using the specified filename and listening address, using the default port.
1039   *
1040   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
1041   * @param listenAddress the address to listen on, or empty to listen on any address
1042   */
1043  public void startServer(String persistFilename, String listenAddress) {
1044    startServer(persistFilename, listenAddress, kDefaultPort3, kDefaultPort4);
1045  }
1046
1047  /**
1048   * Starts a server using the specified filename, listening address, and port.
1049   *
1050   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
1051   * @param listenAddress the address to listen on, or empty to listen on any address
1052   * @param port3 port to communicate over (NT3)
1053   */
1054  public void startServer(String persistFilename, String listenAddress, int port3) {
1055    startServer(persistFilename, listenAddress, port3, kDefaultPort4);
1056  }
1057
1058  /**
1059   * Starts a server using the specified filename, listening address, and port.
1060   *
1061   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
1062   * @param listenAddress the address to listen on, or empty to listen on any address
1063   * @param port3 port to communicate over (NT3)
1064   * @param port4 port to communicate over (NT4)
1065   */
1066  public void startServer(String persistFilename, String listenAddress, int port3, int port4) {
1067    NetworkTablesJNI.startServer(m_handle, persistFilename, listenAddress, port3, port4);
1068  }
1069
1070  /** Stops the server if it is running. */
1071  public void stopServer() {
1072    NetworkTablesJNI.stopServer(m_handle);
1073  }
1074
1075  /**
1076   * Starts a NT3 client. Use SetServer or SetServerTeam to set the server name and port.
1077   *
1078   * @param identity network identity to advertise (cannot be empty string)
1079   */
1080  public void startClient3(String identity) {
1081    NetworkTablesJNI.startClient3(m_handle, identity);
1082  }
1083
1084  /**
1085   * Starts a NT4 client. Use SetServer or SetServerTeam to set the server name and port.
1086   *
1087   * @param identity network identity to advertise (cannot be empty string)
1088   */
1089  public void startClient4(String identity) {
1090    NetworkTablesJNI.startClient4(m_handle, identity);
1091  }
1092
1093  /** Stops the client if it is running. */
1094  public void stopClient() {
1095    NetworkTablesJNI.stopClient(m_handle);
1096  }
1097
1098  /**
1099   * Sets server address and port for client (without restarting client). Changes the port to the
1100   * default port.
1101   *
1102   * @param serverName server name
1103   */
1104  public void setServer(String serverName) {
1105    setServer(serverName, 0);
1106  }
1107
1108  /**
1109   * Sets server address and port for client (without restarting client).
1110   *
1111   * @param serverName server name
1112   * @param port port to communicate over (0=default)
1113   */
1114  public void setServer(String serverName, int port) {
1115    NetworkTablesJNI.setServer(m_handle, serverName, port);
1116  }
1117
1118  /**
1119   * Sets server addresses and port for client (without restarting client). Changes the port to the
1120   * default port. The client will attempt to connect to each server in round robin fashion.
1121   *
1122   * @param serverNames array of server names
1123   */
1124  public void setServer(String[] serverNames) {
1125    setServer(serverNames, 0);
1126  }
1127
1128  /**
1129   * Sets server addresses and port for client (without restarting client). The client will attempt
1130   * to connect to each server in round robin fashion.
1131   *
1132   * @param serverNames array of server names
1133   * @param port port to communicate over (0=default)
1134   */
1135  public void setServer(String[] serverNames, int port) {
1136    int[] ports = new int[serverNames.length];
1137    for (int i = 0; i < serverNames.length; i++) {
1138      ports[i] = port;
1139    }
1140    setServer(serverNames, ports);
1141  }
1142
1143  /**
1144   * Sets server addresses and ports for client (without restarting client). The client will
1145   * attempt to connect to each server in round robin fashion.
1146   *
1147   * @param serverNames array of server names
1148   * @param ports array of port numbers (0=default)
1149   */
1150  public void setServer(String[] serverNames, int[] ports) {
1151    NetworkTablesJNI.setServer(m_handle, serverNames, ports);
1152  }
1153
1154  /**
1155   * Sets server addresses and port for client (without restarting client). Changes the port to the
1156   * default port. The client will attempt to connect to each server in round robin fashion.
1157   *
1158   * @param team team number
1159   */
1160  public void setServerTeam(int team) {
1161    setServerTeam(team, 0);
1162  }
1163
1164  /**
1165   * Sets server addresses and port for client (without restarting client). Connects using commonly
1166   * known robot addresses for the specified team.
1167   *
1168   * @param team team number
1169   * @param port port to communicate over (0=default)
1170   */
1171  public void setServerTeam(int team, int port) {
1172    NetworkTablesJNI.setServerTeam(m_handle, team, port);
1173  }
1174
1175  /**
1176   * Starts requesting server address from Driver Station. This connects to the Driver Station
1177   * running on localhost to obtain the server IP address, and connects with the default port.
1178   */
1179  public void startDSClient() {
1180    startDSClient(0);
1181  }
1182
1183  /**
1184   * Starts requesting server address from Driver Station. This connects to the Driver Station
1185   * running on localhost to obtain the server IP address.
1186   *
1187   * @param port server port to use in combination with IP from DS (0=default)
1188   */
1189  public void startDSClient(int port) {
1190    NetworkTablesJNI.startDSClient(m_handle, port);
1191  }
1192
1193  /** Stops requesting server address from Driver Station. */
1194  public void stopDSClient() {
1195    NetworkTablesJNI.stopDSClient(m_handle);
1196  }
1197
1198  /**
1199   * Flushes all updated values immediately to the local client/server. This does not flush to the
1200   * network.
1201   */
1202  public void flushLocal() {
1203    NetworkTablesJNI.flushLocal(m_handle);
1204  }
1205
1206  /**
1207   * Flushes all updated values immediately to the network. Note: This is rate-limited to protect
1208   * the network from flooding. This is primarily useful for synchronizing network updates with
1209   * user code.
1210   */
1211  public void flush() {
1212    NetworkTablesJNI.flush(m_handle);
1213  }
1214
1215  /**
1216   * Gets information on the currently established network connections. If operating as a client,
1217   * this will return either zero or one values.
1218   *
1219   * @return array of connection information
1220   */
1221  public ConnectionInfo[] getConnections() {
1222    return NetworkTablesJNI.getConnections(m_handle);
1223  }
1224
1225  /**
1226   * Return whether or not the instance is connected to another node.
1227   *
1228   * @return True if connected.
1229   */
1230  public boolean isConnected() {
1231    return NetworkTablesJNI.isConnected(m_handle);
1232  }

1234  /**
1235   * Starts logging entry changes to a DataLog.
1236   *
1237   * @param log data log object; lifetime must extend until StopEntryDataLog is called or the
1238   *     instance is destroyed
1239   * @param prefix only store entries with names that start with this prefix; the prefix is not
1240   *     included in the data log entry name
1241   * @param logPrefix prefix to add to data log entry names
1242   * @return Data logger handle
1243   */
1244  public int startEntryDataLog(DataLog log, String prefix, String logPrefix) {
1245    return NetworkTablesJNI.startEntryDataLog(m_handle, log, prefix, logPrefix);
1246  }
1247
1248  /**
1249   * Stops logging entry changes to a DataLog.
1250   *
1251   * @param logger data logger handle
1252   */
1253  public static void stopEntryDataLog(int logger) {
1254    NetworkTablesJNI.stopEntryDataLog(logger);
1255  }
1256
1257  /**
1258   * Starts logging connection changes to a DataLog.
1259   *
1260   * @param log data log object; lifetime must extend until StopConnectionDataLog is called or the
1261   *     instance is destroyed
1262   * @param name data log entry name
1263   * @return Data logger handle
1264   */
1265  public int startConnectionDataLog(DataLog log, String name) {
1266    return NetworkTablesJNI.startConnectionDataLog(m_handle, log, name);
1267  }
1268
1269  /**
1270   * Stops logging connection changes to a DataLog.
1271   *
1272   * @param logger data logger handle
1273   */
1274  public static void stopConnectionDataLog(int logger) {
1275    NetworkTablesJNI.stopConnectionDataLog(logger);
1276  }
1277
1278  /**
1279   * Add logger callback function. By default, log messages are sent to stderr; this function sends
1280   * log messages with the specified levels to the provided callback function instead. The callback
1281   * function will only be called for log messages with level greater than or equal to minLevel and
1282   * less than or equal to maxLevel; messages outside this range will be silently ignored.
1283   *
1284   * @param minLevel minimum log level
1285   * @param maxLevel maximum log level
1286   * @param func callback function
1287   * @return Listener handle
1288   */
1289  public int addLogger(int minLevel, int maxLevel, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> func) {
1290    return m_listeners.addLogger(minLevel, maxLevel, func);
1291  }
1292
1293  @Override
1294  public boolean equals(Object other) {
1295    if (other == this) {
1296      return true;
1297    }
1298    if (!(other instanceof NetworkTableInstance)) {
1299      return false;
1300    }
1301
1302    return m_handle == ((NetworkTableInstance) other).m_handle;
1303  }
1304
1305  @Override
1306  public int hashCode() {
1307    return m_handle;
1308  }
1309
1310  private boolean m_owned;
1311  private int m_handle;
1312}
